### Juan Díaz-Colunga<subhead>Group Leader</subhead>

::::: grid
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
![](pics/people/jdc.jpg){.headshot-image}
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-8}
Juan holds a BSc in Physics, an MSc in Biomedical Engineering, and a PhD in Biophysics. Before joining the Spanish National Research Council as a junior group leader, he conducted postdoctoral research at the UAM School of Medicine and at Yale University’s Department of Ecology and Evolutionary Biology, where he worked in the laboratories of [Álvaro Sánchez](https://sanchezlaboratory.weebly.com/){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} and [C. Brandon Ogbunugafor](https://ogbunulab.yale.edu/){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}. He is broadly interested in the fields of systems biology, evolutionary genetics, and microbial ecology.

Outside the lab, he enjoys movies, videogames, and all kinds of sports.

**Email:** [juan.diaz\@ipla.csic.es](mailto:juan.diaz@ipla.csic.es){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}

[CV](files/jdc_cv.pdf){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} · [GitHub](https://github.com/jdiazc9){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} · [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=MJIf7vAAAAAJ&hl=en){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} · [Twitter/X](https://x.com/jdiazc9){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} · [BlueSky](https://bsky.app/profile/jdiazc9.bsky.social){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}

### Alicia Rodríguez-Cárdenas<subhead>Lab Manager</subhead>

::::: grid
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
![](pics/people/NA.png){.headshot-image}
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-8}

Alicia holds an advanced technical qualification (FPII) in Clinical and Biomedical Laboratory Sciences. Before joining the lab, she worked in plant microbiology at [IMIDRA](https://www.comunidad.madrid/servicios/medio-rural/investigacion-agraria){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}, and in cell culture and immunology at [CBM](https://www.cbm.uam.es/){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} in Madrid. She also gained experience in clinical diagnostics at the [Central Veterinary Laboratory](https://www.mapa.gob.es/en/ganaderia/temas/laboratorios-sanidad-genetica/referencia-ue/sobre-nosotros/instalaciones_eurl){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"} of the Spanish Ministry of Agriculture.

Outside the lab, she enjoys music, playing the saxophone in jazz and big bands, studying psychology, and spending time in nature and hiking.

**Email:** [alicia.rodriguez\@ipla.csic.es](mailto:alicia.rodriguez@ipla.csic.es){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}
:::

### Anna Sigalou<subhead>Postdoc</subhead>

::::: grid
::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
![](pics/people/NA.png){.headshot-image}
:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-8}
Anna holds an MEng in Mechanical Engineering, an MSc in Applied Mathematical Sciences, and a PhD in Statistics. Before joining the lab, she worked as a teaching assistant in Statistics at the [University of Leeds](https://eps.leeds.ac.uk/maths){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}. Her previous research focused on collective animal behavior, particularly sociality and decision-making, but she is broadly interested in using mathematical models to study interactions and long-term behavior in physical systems.

Outside of work, she enjoys yoga, exercise, cooking, and occasionally crocheting.

**Email:** [anna.sigalou\@ipla.csic.es](mailto:anna.sigalou@ipla.csic.es){target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer"}
